DataElement.preferredName: Diagnostic Imaging Iobenguane Curie Scan Assessment Relative Score
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the relative score related to an Iobenguane (MIBG; a synthetic analogue of the adrenergic neurotransmitter norepinephrine with potential diagnostic imaging or antineoplastic activity when radiolabeled) curie (a unit of radioactivity) scan (the image obtained by gathering information with a sensing device) assessment (the final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of) versus previous assessment findings.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Diagnostic Imaging Iobenguane Curie Scan Assessment
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to an Iobenguane (MIBG; a synthetic analogue of the adrenergic neurotransmitter norepinephrine with potential diagnostic imaging or antineoplastic activity when radiolabeled) curie (a unit of radioactivity) scan (the image obtained by gathering information with a sensing device) assessment (the final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any method that uses a visual display of structural or functional patterns of organs or tissues for diagnostic evaluation..

Concepts.definition: Any method that uses a visual display of structural or functional patterns of organs or tissues for diagnostic evaluation.

Property.preferredDefinition: A synthetic, aralkylguanidine analogue of the adrenergic neurotransmitter norepinephrine (NE) and adrenergic neuron blocking agent with potential diagnostic imaging or antineoplastic activity when radiolabeled. Iobenguane, also known as metaiodobenzylguanidine (MIBG), localizes to adrenergic tissue and is taken up and accumulates in the granules of pre-synaptic adrenergic neurons. In radiolabeled forms, iobenguane may be used to image or eradicate neuroendocrine tissues and tumor cells.:A unit of radioactivity in the CGS system, defined as 3.7 E10 atomic disintegrations or other nuclear transformations per second. One curie is equal to 37 gigabecquerels.:The data or image obtained by gathering information with a sensing device.:The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

Concepts.definition: A synthetic, aralkylguanidine analogue of the adrenergic neurotransmitter norepinephrine (NE) and adrenergic neuron blocking agent with potential diagnostic imaging or antineoplastic activity when radiolabeled. Iobenguane, also known as metaiodobenzylguanidine (MIBG), is taken up and accumulates in the granules of adrenal medullary chromaffin cells and in the pre-synaptic granules of adrenergic neurons in a manner almost identical with that of NE. In radiolabeled forms, iobenguane may be used to image or eradicate neuroendocrine tissues and tumor cells.
A unit of radioactivity in the CGS system, defined as 3.7 E10 atomic disintegrations or other nuclear transformations per second. One curie is equal to 37 gigabecquerels.
The data or image obtained by gathering information with a sensing device.
The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the relative score related to a MIBG curie scan, versus previous assessment findings.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.
